thing-type.label: builtInDimmer Built-in Dimmer
thing-type.description: Built-in Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtBasic operations</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtThe Built-in Dimmer can trigger any rule or lifestyle.</li&gt <li&gtThe Built-in Dimmer can dim up to 125Watt.</li&gt <li&gtThe Built-in Dimmer can be placed behind your wall switch (41*41*13mm).</li&gt <li&gtThe Built-in Dimmer is easy to install and configured.</li&gt <li&gtThe Built-in Dimmer will power itself through halogen or incandescent light. (no blue wire or neutral line is needed)</li&gt <li&gtIndoor use only. </li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtWhen the light is off (!) press/flip the wall switch once, after circa two seconds release/flip back the wall switch to start the inclusion process. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtWhen the light is off (!) press/flip the wall switch once, after circa two seconds release/flip back the wall switch to start the exclusion process.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Reset to factory settings
parameter.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings).

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: The way how the button reacts when press/released
parameter.description: The way how the button reacts when press/released

options.option: Toggle light when button is pressed only
Toggle light on release, dimming on press
Toggle on press & Dim with quick press & release

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Control Type
parameter.description: The way the Built-in Dimmer reacts when light is turned on/off with button

options.option: Switch own light on and send message to all nodes
Don't switch own light. only send to extern node

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Enable dimming
parameter.description: Enable dimming<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is used to enable the dimming option of the product.</p&gt <p&gtWhen disabled the dimming and fading routine are disabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Maximum load
parameter.description: Maximum load<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe maximum power load in watts when light is turned on, when measured higher then this value the Inline Dimmer is automatically turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Dimming speed
parameter.description: Dimming speed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe speed of dimming when activated (manual and RF). Dim speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Fading up speed
parameter.description: Fading up speed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe speed of fading when activated (manual and RF). Fade speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Toggle time
parameter.description: Toggle time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe time window to re-press button to start dimming. Toggle time is value (* 10ms)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Auto meter report: percentage
parameter.description: Auto meter report: percentage<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtA percentage that an energy value must be different compared to a previous sent value before an unsolicited meter report is sent.</p&gt <p&gtMinimum value = 10% Maximum value = 100%</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Auto meter report: watt
parameter.description: Auto meter report: watt<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtA watt value that an energy value must be different compared to a previous sent value before an unsolicited meter report is sent.</p&gt <p&gtMinimum value = 5 watt Maximum value = 255 watt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Auto meter report: time
parameter.description: Auto meter report: time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtA time value that has to be passed compared to a previous sent value before a unsolicited meter report is sent.</p&gt <p&gtMinimum value = 10 seconds Maximum value = 255 seconds</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Last known status
parameter.description: Last known status<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhat to do with lamp status when power applied.</p&gt <p&gtIf 0x00: Always switch light off when power applied.</p&gt <p&gtIf &gt; 0x00: Switch lamp on/off depending on last known lamp status before power was disconnected.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Fading down speed
parameter.description: Fading down speed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe speed of fading when activated (manual and RF).</p&gt <p&gtFade speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Group 1
parameter.description: All nodes in this group will receive a BASIC_SET frame<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtAll nodes in this group will receive a BASIC_SET frame when light is set to a certain state with the button of the Built-in Dimmer (manual switching).</p&gt <p&gtWhen light is switched off with button: BASIC_SET frame with value 0 is sent to associated nodes.</p&gt <p&gtWhen light is set to a dim level with button: BASIC_SET frame with value 0 – 99 is sent to associated nodes.</p&gt <p&gtWhen light is switched on with button: BASIC_SET frame with value 255 is sent to associated nodes.</p&gt <p&gtIt is most likely that switch_binary/switch_multilevel devices are associated in this group so that you can switch multiple nodes on/off with 1 button pres</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe node associated in this group will receive a SWITCH_MULTILEVEL_REPORT frame every time the level of light is changed, where the value represents the (changed) dim level. The status is reported after every change that means manual but also if changed by Z-Wave.</p&gt <p&gtThe node in this group will also received the (auto) METER_REPORT (see § COMMAND_CLASS_METER à unsolicited METER_REPORT for more information about this feature).</p&gt <p&gtIt is most likely that a controller or screen is associated in this group to report (unsolicited) any changes to the light.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Group 3
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtIf configured that the control mode is extern only (configuration param3 à value 1) then a BASIC_SET frame is sent to the node in this group when the button is changed. Note that the light of the Built-in Dimmer is not switched on/off but instead the BASIC_SET frame is sent, because the Built-in Dimmer doesn’t know what the extern status is the value of the BASIC_SET frame toggles between the values 0 and 255.</p&gt <p&gtIt is most likely that a Gateway (controller) is associated in this group. A Gateway can handle upon the received frame. With a Gateway controlled network it possible to add multiple functionalities to the button of the Builtin Dimmer.</p&gt
